title: Item Hierarchies
text: Please note that currently, it is not feasible to relocate or reposition hierarchy nodes within the hierarchy structure. This section provides you with the ability to handle the Hierarchy Nodes, often referred to as Departments and Categories. Definitions - The Hierarchy Nodes can be classified into two types: Root Nodes and Sub Nodes. A Root Node signifies the highest level within the hierarchy. Sub Node means it is below the Root level. This can be 1 or more levels below. Edit a Hierarchy Node To Edit a Root Node / Sub Node click the pencil to the right and amend the details on the form and Save. Delete a Hierarchy Node NOTE: Hierarchy Nodes can only be deleted if no items are using them. Choose the X to the right of a Root or Sub Node and choose Delete. Should there still be items, a warning top right will appear and the delete request will be ignored.
description:
Please note that currently, it is not feasible to relocate or reposition hierarchy nodes within the hierarchy structure.

This section provides you with the ability to handle the Hierarchy Nodes, often referred to as Departments and Categories.

Definitions - The Hierarchy Nodes can be classified into two types: Root Nodes and Sub Nodes.

A Root Node signifies the highest level within the hierarchy.



Sub Node means it is below the Root level.  This can be 1 or more levels below. 



Edit a Hierarchy Node

To Edit a Root Node / Sub Node click the pencil to the right and amend the details on the form and Save.



Delete a Hierarchy Node

NOTE: Hierarchy Nodes can only be deleted if no items are using them. 

Choose the X to the right of a Root or Sub Node and choose Delete.



Should there still be items, a warning top right will appear and the delete request will be ignored.

title: Create Hierarchies Root Node
text: Click on Create a Root Node from the top menu bar. Fill in the fields as required once completed click "Save". Code This must be unique as it identifies the Root Node. It may be used in reports, data export/import, and can consist of any combination of letters and numbers. Image URL Not in use. Tax Rates A drop-down list showing all available tax rates. When creating an item, this tax rate will be assigned to the item by default, saving time in selection. It is recommended to set the most commonly used tax rate for the root node, but it can be changed when creating the item. Label Template A drop-down list showing all available label templates. When creating an item, this label template will be assigned to the item by default, saving time in selection. It is recommended to set the most commonly used label template for the root node, but it can be changed when creating the item and printing a label at a later date.
description:
Click on Create a Root Node from the top menu bar. 



Fill in the fields as required once completed click "Save".


CodeThis must be unique as it identifies the Root Node. It may be used in reports, data export/import, and can consist of any combination of letters and numbers.
Image URLNot in use.
Tax RatesA drop-down list showing all available tax rates. When creating an item, this tax rate will be assigned to the item by default, saving time in selection. It is recommended to set the most commonly used tax rate for the root node, but it can be changed when creating the item.
Label TemplateA drop-down list showing all available label templates. When creating an item, this label template will be assigned to the item by default, saving time in selection. It is recommended to set the most commonly used label template for the root node, but it can be changed when creating the item and printing a label at a later date.

title: Create Hierarchies Sub Node
text: Sub Node - To add a Sub Node, click on the PLUS button [+] to the right of the relevant Root or Sub Node. This opens the same form used to create the Root Node. Fill in all relevant details and Save. Sub Nodes appear under the Root Node. Use the arrow to the left of the node description to expand and collapse the Hierarchy levels.
description:
Sub Node - To add a Sub Node, click on the PLUS button [+] to the right of the relevant Root or Sub Node. 



This opens the same form used to create the Root Node.  

Fill in all relevant details and Save. 

Sub Nodes appear under the Root Node. Use the arrow to the left of the node description to expand and collapse the Hierarchy levels.
